original: HOLMGREN, Frithiof Frithiofsson, Civilingenjör, Stora Essingen, f Upps 14/4 84 av prof A F H o förf:an Ann-Margret Tersmeden, gm (1) Elvine von Koch, (2) Ruth We-ding. Mog.ex Gävle 01, KTH (E) 02—05, Techn Hochschule i Berlin-Charlottenburg 05—06. Anst v Elektr Prövn.anst i Sthlm 06, ing v AEG:s banavd i Berlin 07—08, v offertavd h Maschinenfabrik Oerlikon i Schweiz 08—10 o v bankraftverksavd h Siemens Schuckert Werke i Berlin 10—11, elektroing o maskining v Saltsjöbanan 11—13, anst v Elektr Prövn.anst 13—15, deläg o chef där 15—28, anst v IVA 29—36. Led av kurs i elektrotekn v gen.staben 19, IVA:s kurs f gruving, hytting o bergs-mekanister 22, kurs i elektrotekn v militär-förvaltn.kursen 24, lär i elektr mättekn v Tekn Inst 43. Anordn första sv svetsn.konf m utställn o utgav handl därifrån 30. Radioföreläsare fr 31. Sekr o ombudsman i Sv Studie-kommiss f svetsn.frågor 31—35 samt sekr i studienmdn f korrosionsskyddsfrågor 33—36, sekr i IVA:s lin-kté 34. Sakk v tillsätt av spec.lärarebefattn v KTH 34. Led av Sv Konsult Ing:s Frn 15—29 o sekr där 16—20. Gene-ralkorresp f Verein Deutscher Ing fr 32. Med-arb i Tekn Tidskr sed. 07, Elinstallatören sed. 40, STI-Ingenjören sed. 43, Svetsaren sed. 42. Av trycket: C :a 200 avhandl o upps i fack-tidskr mfl. Hobbies: Friluftsliv, musik (c:a 50 komp). <sup>o</sup>HOLMGREN, Gottfrid Magnus, Bergsingenjör, Äppelviken, f Malmö 28/7 80 av överkonduktör J H o Johanna Svensson, gm Anna Iwarsson. Mog.ex Mmö 01, KTH 02—06, avg.-ex där sistn år. Rit v Carnegie Steel Co, Homestead, Pa, USA, 07—08, kemist v Mac Intyre Iron Co, Tahawus, NY, 08—09, konstr av anrikn.maskiner h Witherbee, Sherman & Co, Mineville, NY, samma år, gruving h Oliver Iron Mining Co, Duluth, Minn, 09—10, ing h The Minn Syndicate, Winnipeg, Man, Canada, 11—13, ing h Mac Intyre Iron Co, Tahawus, NY, o Titanium Alloy Mfg Co, Niagara Falls, NY, 13—14, anst h AB Elektriska Ugnar, Sthlm, 15—23, därefter byrå-ing i Sthlms stds gasverk.
translated:
HOLMGREN, Frithiof Frithiofsson, Civil Engineer, Stora Essingen, born in Uppsala on April 14, 1884, to Professor A.F.H. Holmgren and author Ann-Margret Tersmeden. Married (1) to Elvine von Koch, (2) to Ruth Wedding. Completed secondary education in Gävle in 1901, studied at the KTH (Royal Institute of Technology) from 1902 to 1905, and attended the Technische Hochschule in Berlin-Charlottenburg from 1905 to 1906. Employed at the Electrical Test Institute in Stockholm from 1906, engineer at AEG's railway division in Berlin from 1907 to 1908, in the marketing department of Maschinenfabrik Oerlikon in Switzerland from 1908 to 1910, and in the hydropower department of Siemens Schuckert Werke in Berlin from 1910 to 1911. Served as an electrical engineer and mechanical engineer at Saltsjöbanan from 1911 to 1913, employed at the Electrical Test Institute from 1913 to 1915, and became a partner and manager there from 1915 to 1928. Employed at IVA (Royal Swedish Academy of Engineering Sciences) from 1929 to 1936. Participated in an electrical engineering course organized by the general staff in 1919, attended IVA's mining and metallurgical engineering course in 1922, and took an electrical engineering course at the military administration course in 1924. Taught electrical measurement technology at the Technical Institute in 1943. Organized the first Swedish welding conference and exhibition in 1930, and also published related papers. Gave radio lectures from 1931. Secretary and representative in the Swedish Study Commission for Welding Issues from 1931 to 1935, and secretary in the study council for corrosion protection issues from 1933 to 1936, and secretary in IVA's electrical section in 1934. Expert in the appointment of specialized teaching positions at KTH in 1934. Member of the Swedish Consulting Engineers Association from 1915 to 1929, and secretary there from 1916 to 1920. General correspondent for the Verein Deutscher Ing from 1932. Collaborator in the Tekn Tidskrift from 1907, Elinstallatören from 1940, STI-Ingenjören from 1943, and Svetsaren from 1942. Has published about 200 dissertations and papers in professional journals, among others. Hobbies: Outdoor activities, music (composed around 50 pieces).

HOLMGREN, Gottfrid Magnus, Mining Engineer, Äppelviken, born in Malmö on July 28, 1880, to chief conductor J.H. Holmgren and Johanna Svensson, married to Anna Iwarsson. Completed secondary education in Malmö in 1901, studied at KTH from 1902 to 1906, and completed his final year degree. Worked as a draftsman at Carnegie Steel Co in Homestead, PA, USA, from 1907 to 1908, chemist at Mac Intyre Iron Co in Tahawus, NY, from 1908 to 1909, and construction of ore enrichment machinery at Witherbee, Sherman & Co in Mineville, NY, in the same year. Engaged in mining at Oliver Iron Mining Co in Duluth, MN, from 1909 to 1910, worked as an engineer at The Minn Syndicate in Winnipeg, Manitoba, Canada, from 1911 to 1913, and as an engineer at Mac Intyre Iron Co in Tahawus, NY, and Titanium Alloy Mfg Co in Niagara Falls, NY, from 1913 to 1914. Employed at AB Elektriska Ugnar in Stockholm from 1915 to 1923, and then as a bureau engineer in Stockholm City's gasworks.

employment.name: Royal Swedish Academy of Engineering Sciences (IVA)

career.workplace: Swedish Study Commission for Welding Issues
Study Council for Corrosion Protection Issues
